meanings.definition: The process by which nerve cells communicate with each other.
meanings.sent1: Neurotransmissions are like messages sent between nerve cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study neurotransmissions to understand how our brain works.
meanings.sent3: The party of nerve cells was so loud, their neurotransmissions got mixed up!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a neurotransmissions of joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The neurotransmissions in the brain are like a busy telephone exchange.

meanings.definition: The transmission of signals between neurons in the brain.
meanings.sent1: Neurotransmissions are like little messengers carrying signals in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching neurotransmissions to unlock the mysteries of the brain.
meanings.sent3: The neurotransmissions in his brain were so fast, he felt like a superhero!
meanings.sent4: The neurotransmissions in the brain are like a symphony of information.
meanings.sent5: The neurotransmissions in the brain are crucial for clear thinking and memory.

meanings.definition: The chemical messengers that transmit signals across synapses.
meanings.sent1: Neurotransmissions are like tiny couriers delivering messages in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Learning about neurotransmissions helps us understand how our brain functions.
meanings.sent3: The neurotransmissions in the brain were so efficient, they never missed a delivery!
meanings.sent4: The neurotransmissions in the brain are like keys unlocking the doors of communication.
meanings.sent5: The neurotransmissions in the brain are essential for our thoughts and movements.
